content: what does this line do:     d.text((10, 25), fAPM: {text}, fill=(255, 255, 255))
Draws text 'fAPM: {text}' at position (10, 25) with white color on image d.
how do i make the font larger
Use font parameter: d.text((10, 25), f"APM: {text}", fill=(255, 255, 255), font=ImageFont.truetype("font.ttf", size))
is there an actual font.ttf, like, will this run copied and pasted by default

No. You need a real font file path. Use system fonts like:
d.text((10,25), f"APM: {text}", fill=(255,255,255), font=ImageFont.truetype("/path/to/font.ttf", 24))

Check fonts in /usr/share/fonts/ (Linux), C:\Windows\Fonts (Windows), or /System/Library/Fonts (Mac)
whats another way to change the size? i dont want to figure out some path or something

Use ImageFont.load_default() and specify a size:
d.text((10,25), f"APM: {text}", fill=(255,255,255), font=ImageFont.load_default().font_variant(size=20))
imagefont not defined. is there a way do to this without imports
No, you must import PIL modules. Use: from PIL import ImageFont, then ImageFont.truetype("arial.ttf", 24) or similar.
